quizzes.question: Type in a code that includes the required header file to use string data type in the program:

quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Characters[/h1]

A [b]char [/b]variable holds a 1-byte integer. However, instead of interpreting the value of the [b]char [/b]as an integer, the value of a char variable is typically interpreted as an ASCII character.

A character is enclosed between [b]single quotes[/b] (such as 'a', 'b', etc).
[b]For example:[/b][code format="cpp" ][b]char [/b]test = 'S';[/code]
[note][b]American Standard Code for Information Interchange (ASCII)[/b] is a character-encoding scheme that is used to represent text in computers.[/note]

[h1]Booleans[/h1]

Boolean variables only have two possible values: [b]true [/b](1) and [b]false [/b](0).
To declare a boolean variable, we use the keyword [b]bool[/b]. [code format="cpp"][b]bool [/b]online = false;
[b]bool [/b]logged_in = true;[/code]
[note]If a Boolean value is assigned to an integer, [b]true [/b]becomes 1 and [b]false [/b]becomes 0.
If an integer value is assigned to a Boolean, 0 becomes [b]false [/b]and any value that has a non-zero value becomes [b]true[/b].[/note]
